results.title: Tennis basics: the forehand
results.brief_description: Dennis Ralston introduces the film by demonstrating the basic forehand stroke and encouraging students to feel the movements as they are pictured. Animation shows the exact positions of each part of the body at every stage of the swing.

results.title: Tennis basics: the backhand
results.brief_description: American tennis professional Dennis Ralston demonstrates the backhand stroke. Simple animated figures are used to show the basic positions of the arms, legs, body and head during each phase of the swing. Viewer participation is also included.

results.title: Tennessee Williams: theater in process
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Tedesko, Encyclopaedia Britannica Educational Corporation, Signet Productions and Richard Slote
results.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at the production of the play “The red devil battery sign” by Tennessee Williams. Tennessee Williams talks about his career and about writing a play and how he works with a director rather than with the actors. The film shows a press conference, rehearsals of lines and then full rehearsals during which the director conveys his interpretation of some of the important symbols and speeches in the play
results.creator_credit_for_label: Suzanne Tedesko, Encyclopaedia Britannica Educational Corporation, Signet Productions and Richard Slote

results.title: Tennessee volunteers
results.brief_description: A project was sponsored by the University of Tennessee to build a children’s playground with the help of the community. In this way, building costs were low, and children involved gained more respect for the equipment, having helped to build it. Members of the community brought their own tools and gave their time, whilst local businesses donated equipment and the use of machinery.

results.title: Tenebrae
results.creator_credit: Claudio Argento, Sigma Cinematografica and Dario Argento
results.brief_description: For the uninitiated, Italian horror director Dario Argento (or the Italian Hitchcock as he is affectionately referred as by his fans) has fashioned a career on very stylish and very violent ‘Giallo’ thrillers. Tenebrae is classic Argento featuring intricately orchestrated deaths, perverse pathologies and labyrinth plotting. American mystery writer Peter Neil (Anthony Franciosa) finds himself the target of a serial killer while on a promotional tour in Rome. It seems that the murderer is literally taking a leaf out of Neil’s book by stuffing pages of his latest thriller into the victims mouths. Neil soon finds himself embroiled in the killers sick fantasies and a prime police suspect. Argento in the past has come under considerable fire with feminists and critics who have felt that his unrelenting carnage of women in his films borders on rampant misogyny. Tenebrae isn’t so much an answer to feminists but a provocative and cheeky slap in the face, offering even more elaborate female mutilation, castrating temptresses in red stilettos and a lesbian feminist critic who meets a horrible and violent end. Music by Goblin. Cast includes: Christian Borromeo, Mirella D’Angelo, Veronica Lario, John Saxon, Ania Pieroni.

results.title: Tenants
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place of Your Own”.
The rental market is seen as the traditional first step for young people leaving home. This tape looks at the situation for three young people

results.title: Ten years of Countdown
results.brief_description: The first ten years of Countdown coincided with, and was part of, an incredible growth in the Australian music scene. The emergence of a wealth of new talent, highlighted by Countdown appearances, is represented by the performances which includes Skyhooks, AC/DC, Australian Crawl, Split Enz, Inxs, Mondo Rock, Renee Geyer, Richard Clapton, Ted Mulray Gang and others.

results.title: Ten years of co-op credit
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of Agriculture and Walter Scott
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of rural production credit associations in the US during World War 2. These associations were set up by farmers to help each other and themselves through the depression years; in 1943 they were helping to boost agricultural production as part of the national war effort of the US during WW2.

results.title: Ten years after...ten years older
results.creator_credit: Anna Kannava and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: After a ten year absence, the filmmaker returns to her beloved country of birth - Cyprus. This film is about a return to origins, memory, expectations and realisations. 1987 ATOM Award finalist.
